panoramas.title: Keplinger Hall
panoramas.description: Home to the College of Engineering and Natural Sciences, Keplinger Hall is an impressive $15- million facility for research and discovery. This building supports multiple departments, including chemistry and biochemistry, physics, geosciences, chemical engineering, and mathematical sciences. In addition to the lecture rooms, study areas and faculty offices, Keplinger Hall's laboratories allow for sophisticated research in nuclear physics, robotics, optics, polymers and more.

videos.title: Living on Campus The University of Tulsa
videos.description: Living on Campus The University of Tulsa

hotspots.title: Tour the Kendall Bell at Bayless Plaza

video.title: Tour the Kendall Bell at Bayless Plaza
video.description: Dedicated in 2006, the Bayless Plaza provides a spectacular permanent home for TU’s historic Kendall Bell, which has been rung by students completing their last final exam for nearly 75 years. In addition to the centerpiece bell cupola encircled by cast-stone columns, the plaza features brick walkways and benches, making it a gathering place in the heart of campus. The plaza is named in honor of Bernice Bayless (BS ’49) and her late husband, Robert Bayless (BA ’49), whose generous gift funded this landmark.

panoramas.title: Chapman Activity Center
panoramas.description: The Allen Chapman Activity Center, or ACAC, is a buzzing nexus of student life at TU, where many of the University's clubs and organizations meet up. Outdoor picnic tables and benches surround ACAC, providing plenty of room to study and snack in the sun. Inside, students can dine at Bonici Brothers and Chick Fil- A, get a caffeine fix at the Coffee Cafe, or catch a game and a snack at the campus sports bar, the Hurricane Hut. ACAC also houses the campus bookstore and the Great Hall which regularly features notable speakers and national figures.

video.title: Student Union Tour
video.description: Allen Chapman Student Union serves as the "community center" for university students, employees, alumni, and guests. Immediately surrounding are seating areas with covered picnic tables and benches, and the spacious "Outback" - green space for relaxing, studying or for planned activities. Renovations completed in 2014 feature the addition of eight dining establishments, entrances and lecture rooms will receive facelifts, and outdoor patio space will be added around the building.  Amenities:  Administrative Conference Room ATM C-Store Chouteau Room Dining Services Administration Faculty Club Lounge Food Court Gallery Hall Great Hall Hurricane Hut Sports Bar and Grill Mail Services/Mail Boxes Summer Conference Services Volunteer Student Center Student Association Hours: Monday – Friday 7 a.m. – 11 p.m. Saturday 8 a.m. – 11 p.m. Sunday 11 a.m. – 11 p.m.

panoramas.title: Holmes Student Center
panoramas.description: At the Holmes Student Center, TU students can discover opportunities for both work and play. This building houses the Office of Student Affairs which oversees many of the programs that keep things hopping on campus, such as Greek Life, Multicultural Affairs, and Student Activities. Also at the Holmes Student Center, students seeking jobs and internships can receive guidance at the Career Services office, and the Volunteer Center provides students with opportunities to serve their community.

hotspots.title: An Inside Look at TU's Newest Residence Hall

video.title: An Inside Look at TU's Newest Residence Hall
video.description: Opened in 2015, Hardesty Hall is TU's newest campus residence hall. Hardesty Hall is coed, suite-style living and is also home to the Holmes Student Center, Student Affairs and the Center for Student Success. panoramas.title: McFarlin Library
panoramas.description: Originally dedicated in 1929, The McFarlin Library has a longstanding history with the university. The building has undergone a number of renovations, including a five-story eastern addition in 1967, and an underground western annex in 1979. Students have access to the library’s computer labs, expansive print an electronic collections, room of rare and unusual books and artifacts, and tranquil sunken courtyard.

panoramas.title: Samson Plaza
panoramas.description: Samson Plaza was named in honor of one of Tulsa's most notable businessmen, Charles Schusterman, who founded the highly successful private oil-and-gas company, Samson Investment Company. The open and airy plaza spans 1.5 acres and features a soothing fountain with a black granite base. Situated among several of the school's large classroom buildings, Samson Plaza is a prime area for studying outdoors or relaxing with friends between classes.

hotspots.title: Take A Tour of McFarlin Library

video.title: Take A Tour of McFarlin Library
video.description: Take a virtual tour of McFarlin Library. The Department of Special Collections and University Archives at McFarlin Library hosts world-class collections of rare books, manuscripts, photographs, artwork, and other objects, including one of the five largest collections in the world on the celebrated Irish writer James Joyce and the life archive of Nobel Laureate Sir V.S. Naipaul. Other significant collections include a wide variety of British, Irish, and American modernist literature, a large and varied collection of materials on World War I, Native American history and culture, and Tulsa Race Relations. The Department of Special Collections and University Archives also offers an important array of research materials for scholars worldwide as well as TU faculty and students. Learn more here: https://bit.ly/33gdWf0.  Stay Connected: Website: https://utulsa.edu/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/utulsa/  Twitter: https://twitter.com/utulsa  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/utulsa.edu/? Snapchat: @utulsa

panoramas.title: Sharp Memorial Chapel
panoramas.description: Dedicated in 1959, Sharp Memorial Chapel can be found in the heart of campus, right in the historic U-shaped Dietler Commons. This intimate and intricately designed chapel features slabs of Arkansas and Tennessee stone, French-made mosaic-style picture windows, and a pipe organ and concert piano. The main sanctuary can seat up 250 people, with additional seating on the balcony, and a separate designated space for private prayer and meditation.

hotspots.title: MBB vs. Wichita State - Game Winning Shot

video.title: MBB vs. Wichita State - Game Winning Shot

panoramas.title: Stephenson Hall
panoramas.description: Stephenson Hall is a nearly 40,000 square foot building, and host to the university’s thriving Schools of Petroleum and Mechanical Engineering. This beautiful two-story Gothic-style building is comprised of 16 large classroom with integrated laboratory spaces, over 30 faculty and graduate student offices, and a student organizations office. Stephenson Hall also offers four student lounge areas, as well as a large conference room to help facilitate independent research and study for students in the department.

panoramas.title: Keplinger Hall
panoramas.description: Home to the College of Engineering and Natural Sciences, Keplinger Hall is an impressive $15- million facility for research and discovery. This building supports multiple departments, including chemistry and biochemistry, physics, geosciences, chemical engineering, and mathematical sciences. In addition to the lecture rooms, study areas and faculty offices, Keplinger Hall's laboratories allow for sophisticated research in nuclear physics, robotics, optics, polymers and more.

hotspots.title: 360 Tour of a Fisher South dorm room

video.title: 360 Tour of a Fisher South dorm room
video.description: Take a 360 tour of a typical dorm room in the Fisher South residential hall.

panoramas.title: Kendall Hall
panoramas.description: Kendall Hall is home to TU’s vibrant Theatre Department, which is renowned for its commitment to high-quality performance art. The building features two full theatres, costume and set shops, and a computer design lab to offer students the resources to challenge themselves and elevate their stage productions. The department welcomes those from all academic disciplines to participate in the multitude of student-run projects developed at Kendall Hall.

panoramas.title: John Rogers Hall
panoramas.description: John Rogers Hall provides a newly renovated, sleek environment for housing the TU College of Law, which was included in the U.S. News & World Report's 2014 list of Best Law Schools. In 2011, the building was redesigned and refurbished with new classrooms, corridors, energy-efficient lighting,furniture and updated technology. Here, TU's law students can thrive as they study and participate in the College's many skill-enhancing opportunities, such as moot court teams and the pro-bono program.

panoramas.title: Rayzor Hall
panoramas.description: J. Newton Rayzor Hall is an expansive dual-level building, and home to the Computer Science and Electrical Engineering Departments. The building measures in at over 35,000 square feet, and is flanked by two striking vestibule- style entrances, which accentuate the building’s iconic Gothic architecture. Students in the department enjoy learning in the the new state-of-the-art hybrid classroom laboratories, and studying and relaxing in the building’s five student common areas.

video.title: TU Keplinger Renovation Update
video.description: Keplinger Hall's multiphase renovation project at The University of Tulsa continues with support from generous donors. TU students Carter Kraftt and Natalie Santa-Pinter present a comprehensive tour of the remodel. Chapman Commons and Collins Hall Tour

video.title: Chapman Commons and Collins Hall Tour
video.description: Positioned at the focal point of TU's new south entrance project, Collins Hall provides a stunning gateway into the TU campus for visitors and alumni. Collins Hall consolidates key student services, such as financial aid and admission, into one central location. Collins Hall additionally houses the TU Alumni Association offices with meeting spaces for alumni activities, as well as areas where university memorabilia can be displayed. Key university administrators, including the president, have offices within the building. Admission (Undergraduate) Enrollment  Executive Vice President’s Office Law Alumni Association President’s Office Provost’s Office Financial Aid International Student Servies   Stay Connected: Website: https://utulsa.edu/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/utulsa/  Twitter: https://twitter.com/utulsa  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/utulsa.edu/ Snapchat: @utulsa
